features: Electric Height Adjustable: FEZIBO standing desk has reliable motor that could support height adjustment between 27.36''-46.06'' with low noise(under 50 dB) while running
Spacious Work Space: The top shelves with double drawer design expertly make your desktop tidier and helps you head up when you put your screen on it
Stable Construction & Solid Material: Our adjustable desk applied an industrial-grade alloy steel frame combined with a solid desktop that allows for a 176 lbs weight capacity.

Memory Height & Anti-Collison Technology: Standing desk has 3 programmable memory height buttons. If the adjustable desk encounters obstacles when lifting, it will move 2cm in the opposite direction to avoid possible damage or injury

Convenient Installation & Technical Support: A detailed sit stand desk installation video has been uploaded for reference. The package of the desk contains assembly tools and detailed instructions. Please do not hesitate to contact us with any questions or warranty concerns during assembly and use

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Improves Posture: FEZiBO Roll-top Standing desk can help develop good posture at the computer. Your monitor should be at eye level, about 20 inches from your face at a 20-degree tilt, while you should bend your arms at 100-degree angles at your sides.Generate an Energy Burst: Having a standing desk encouraged workers to spend more time on their feet. Small movements and active moments throughout the day help you stay awake and alert.Burns Calories: Standing burns more calories than sitting, even if you simply stand still. Standing burns about 100-200 calories per hour, while sitting burns 60-130 calories.

The FEZiBO 2-drawer standing desk is a contemporary design take on the classic roll-top desk, mixing in history with vintage colour. The style of the 2 drawers (light and handy, Dimension: 3.23’’H * 12.4’’W * 8.46’’D Each ) enhance the overall decoration, help build a wider space for a neat-and-tidy lifestyle, making it easier for items organization.

Each hook can hook your bag, headphones, as well as standing desk balance board. Feel free to hook it on! Swivel casters rotate 360 degrees which make housemoving and relocating the standing desk easy and possible. Protect pets and children from bumps and scratches. A built-in sensor to detect objects during lifting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth. Every. Penny.
reviews.reviewText: I've waited a couple of months to review this desk and let me tell you, it's been worth every penny.MATERIALS:The materials are solid — there's no doubt about that. The shipping weight is 70 lbs., so you know the stuff in it is sturdy.ASSEMBLY:I assembled it by myself without power tools and it took me two and a half hours, mostly due to being extra careful not to scratch the hardwood with any of the pieces.This desk comes together pretty well. I recommend checking your work after every step as once you assemble the legs with the rest of the body, it becomes hard to make those adjustments without unassembling and tightening.FUNCTIONALITY:I use the height adjuster at least a couple of times every day and it runs smoothly every time. Very little noise and it takes 4 seconds to go from 27.5 "to 39.6"My advice if you've never used an adjustable desk — take your time figuring out a standing height that works for you. It might take a few days until you find one that feels seamless.AESTHETIC:I'm pleased with the Rustic Brown finish. It goes well with the floor I had installed in this room just weeks before getting the desk. The wood finish is smooth to the touch and I've spotted no imperfections. The storage is just a bonus — it's not ample, but that's why I liked it. It has just enough space to keep some small stuff on the side drawers and under the top slab. Super happy with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adjustable Desk!
reviews.reviewText: I got it because several reviews I read mentioned it was great quality and easy to assemble. And it was! The directions are simple, just follow the pictures… it took me by myself, maybe an hour to put together. I love how smoothly it goes up and down. It is perfect for my small office space. I got the 55” length. Really great product for an awesome price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for price!
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE having a standing desk! I really love this design, and the coloring, shelving, etc. is very nice and looks great in my home. The assembly was a little tough for me, but I'm far from naturally good at putting furniture together. The desk is pretty narrow, and overall sturdiness could be better but I kind of like that it is slim and aesthetic more than sturdy/clunky.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I inherited an office with a big, bulky desk. I used it for several years but it finally broke in a few places and needed to be replaced. I wanted something that would allow me to stand and was not so bulky.My sister purchased a similar version of this desk and liked it, so I decided to try it for myself. I opted for the longest version available with the LED lights.ASSEMBLY: If you've put together furniture from popular stores, then you'll be fine. All the tools needed are supplied, but if you have power tools it may go a little faster. I was doing this job in my office, so I opted to use the included tools and they worked fine. The instructions are good to list the part numbers for hardware that correspond with the bags, and all the parts are either labeled or so obvious it doesn't matter. There was at least one extra of each piece of hardware, which was nice. I put it together by myself and didn't have a problem, but if you're small you may want an additional hand. You do have to flip it right side up during assembly and that could by tricky by yourself.QUALITY: The finish is nice and nothing was damaged, but it's your typical laminated MDF board. It would probably scratch easy during assembly if you were careless. I think it will hold up to normal use just fine. The control module for raising/lowering the desk is nice with a crisp LED display. The metal looks ince and all the welds are clean.CONS: This really is a nice desk, but if I were going to be picky and I was looking to buy this desk, I'd want to know a few things:LED STRIP: If you opt for a version with the LED strip, know that the adhesive on the back is basically useless. You'll want to have some kind of additional adhesive tape to help it stick on. It's not obvious from the pictures if it's LED tape or some kind of recessed integrated piece, so I wasn't sure what to expect. As far as powering the LED's, they have a male USB-A end and you have to supply the power brick to power them. There is a push button toggle on the cable to turn them off. I do like that they're a warmish neutral white vs. a cool white. I'd say it's around 4000K - not nearly as warm as the pictures make it out to be. The provided strip is also encased in a white, flexible housing to diffuse the light a little to help with hotspots on the LED strip. This helps, but you can still see where each individual LED chip is when you look at the desk. It's not a seamless beam of light like the pictures show, but also not a dealbreaker.CONTROL MODULE PLACEMENT: The control module for raising/lowering the desk must mount on the right side of the desk. A small cable with a wiring harness that originates at the motor plugs into the back of the module, and then the module plugs into the wall. If the manufacturer would extend the cable from the motor to the module, then (with the proper cable management) the control module could be placed on either side. In my situation, I'd prefer to have it on the left. Again, not a huge deal, but something to note.DESK DEPTH: The depth of the desk in relation to the monitor piece is just fine and has plenty of room. However, My monitor stand is really too wide for the stand. If this desk were 30" deep and the elevated part made up for the additional 4", this would fit my monitor perfectly and give a little more storage in the sides. Again, not a dealbreaker or worthy of a return, but that would be helpful.FINAL THOUGHTS: If you're looking at this type of desk I don't think you'll be disappointed! It appears to be worth the price and I expect it to hold up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great standing desk
reviews.reviewText: I love this desk. It was pretty easy to assemble. It’s sturdy, has plenty of space for my needs, and has a wide range of height for sitting or standing. I am 5’7” and use a walking pad under the desk that gives me about another 4” of height, and it still has more room to go. The desk matches my existing black Ikea desk very well so it blends right in. I put my laptop dock in the middle section between the two storage containers so it is hidden and feed the cords through the opening in there. I love the storage also as it holds my notepads, pens, glasses, etc. and keeps the desk looking clean.

Desk arrived on time, very well packaged ! Instructions were clear & Assembly was about 35-40mins but well worth the time- Absolutely great desk- Plenty of room for my 3 monitors and 1 laptop! Rises and descends smoothly. Glass top is a great accent. Would recommend 100%

reviews.reviewTitle: Muy bonito al inicio, falló el motor en mes y medio
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Estaba muy emocionada por este escritorio, pues mi trabajo requiere que esté sentada mucho rato y pensé que tener un escritorio elevado sería la solución. En efecto, el primer mes fue muy útil, pues podía elevarlo y ajustarlo según mis necesidades, además de que está muy bonito el diseño.Por desgracia, hace una semana empezó a darme problemas. La pata izquierda se atora y deja de subir, mientras que la derecha (donde está el motor) sube sin problemas. Esto hace que detenga la elevación (porque no se detiene sola) y me deja con un escritorio chueco. Hay que bajarla lo más que se pueda y tratar de alinearlo, pero el daño ya está hecho. Ya no sube de manera uniforme y se atora. No considero que lo que tengo encima pese mucho, porque según las especificaciones aguanta el peso de una persona, y lo que tengo no pesa más de 10 kg (aunque el cajón de la PC se vea muy grande, realmente tiene poco dentro).Una lástima porque elegí este escritorio por sus buenas reseñas y porque la fabricación es mucho mejor que otras opciones más baratas, y pensé que esto me duraría muchos años. Pero solo aguantó apenas 6 semanas desde que lo instalé.Pediré la devolución o bien un cambio... por un escritorio que tenga motores en ambas patas.

I'm very impressed with this desk. I was really nervous buying a desk online as my monitor is heavy and I hate wobbly things. When I opened the box, each piece felt heavy, with smooth edges and a beautiful finish. All the different hardware accessories were in well identified packages (with extras of each). The instructions were minimalistic, but clear. It took me about 1.5 hours to put it together by myself, while listening to a podcast. All the pre-drilled holes were in the right place, all the pieces aligned perfectly, and all the screws went in smoothly and solidly. Most of the tools were included, the only additional tool needed was a standard phillips screwdriver.The desk is quite sturdy. Even with the wheels on and at the highest setting it doesn't wobble when I type. The motor is very quiet, and super smooth. When going from one preset to another, it moves quickly but it slows down just before stopping so it's perfectly smooth, even with a heavy monitor on it.If you're using the wheels, you may find that the minimum height is a bit high. With wheels it's 30.5" and without it's 28.5". I'm 5'9" and it's just ok for me with the wheels. I'm using the wheels because I have a walking threadmill to the side, so I can move the desk from facing my chair to facing my threadmill easily. I love it! But if you're shorter you may need a foot rest or something.I'm really happy I chose the 40" wide with the two drawers, that gives me plenty of work space without taking up too much space in the room, and it's easy to move. And the double deck allows me to have all my stuff neatly put away, but at my fingertips. I'm super happy with my purchase. In fact, I regret not buying it sooner!
